seg.source: 视频报告显示：小头睡鲨是寿命最长的脊椎动物
seg.translation: Video report: The small-headed sleeper shark is the longest-living vertebrate.
The video report shows that the sleeping shark is the longest-lived vertebrate.
Small-headed sleeping shark is the longest-living vertebrate, video report shows

seg.source: 科学家表示，小头睡鲨 (Greenland shark) 是地球上寿命最长的脊椎动物。
seg.translation: Scientists indicate that the Greenland shark is a vertebrate with the longest lifespan on Earth.
The Greenland shark is the longest-lived vertebrate on earth, scientists say.
Scientists say the Greenland shark is the longest-living vertebrate on Earth.

seg.source: 一直研究鲨鱼的 Julius Nielsen 说，据资料记载，有一头雌性小头睡鲨的年龄预计介于272岁至512岁之间，体长达五米。
seg.translation: Julius Nielsen, who has always been studying sharks, said that according to recorded data, there is a female small-headed sleeper shark with an age of 272 to 512 years and a body length of up to 5 meters.
Julius Nielsen, who has been studying sharks, says the age of a female head sleeper is estimated to be between 272 and 512 years, up to five metres.
Julius Nielsen, who has been studying sharks, said it has been documented that a female calf shark is estimated to be between 272 and 512 years old and up to five metres long.
